intro: Malpighia stevensii, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Malpighiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and produces small, white, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. The berries are edible, though some sources suggest they may be mildly toxic if consumed in large quantities.
